perturbation.original_text:
4.4 Annual Performance Bonuses:

You will be eligible to participate in the Company's discretionary annual performance related bonus scheme to a maximum value of 35% of your Earned Salary in relation to your performance against agreed annual corporate and personal performance objectives as set out below (the "Annual Performance Bonus"). That is, if the compensation committee (the "Compensation Committee") of the board of directors (the "Board") of the Company's parent company, Bicycle Therapeutics plc ("BTL") determines that you have completed all such corporate and personal objectives to its satisfaction in a given year, your bonus would be 35% of your Earned Salary in that year, excluding any other bonuses in this offer. Such bonus may be payable in cash or, in whole or in part, in share options in BTL, as agreed by you and the Compensation Committee following notification by you of your preference at least 90 days prior to the normal payment date (and in the case of share options with the appropriate HMRC valuation process (if required by the Compensation Committee) and Board approval so as to be compliant with BTL's share option plan rules), with due consideration for the operational requirements of the Company at that time in your role as CBO.

Any Annual Performance Bonus paid will not be pensionable and are subject to statutory applicable tax and National Insurance deductions. Performance will be assessed by the Compensation Committee at the end of each calendar year, against annual corporate and personal performance objectives agreed between you and the Board at the start of each calendar year, with any such bonus being payable in the first quarter of the following year. Qualification for your Annual Performance Bonus will require that you are employed by the Company (and have not served notice of termination of your employment to the Company) on 31 December of the year to which your bonus entitlement applies.
perturbation.changed_text:
4.4 Annual Performance Bonuses:

You may be eligible to participate in the Company's discretionary annual performance related bonus scheme. The specific details of the bonus, including the maximum value, performance objectives, and payout structure, will be determined annually by the Compensation Committee (the "Compensation Committee") of the board of directors (the "Board") of the Company's parent company, Bicycle Therapeutics plc ("BTL") at its sole discretion. Any bonus, if awarded, may be payable in cash or, in whole or in part, in share options in BTL, as determined by the Compensation Committee. The Committee may consider your preferences, but the final decision rests with them.

Any bonus paid will not be pensionable and are subject to statutory applicable tax and National Insurance deductions. Performance will be assessed by the Compensation Committee at the end of each calendar year, against performance objectives as the Compensation Committee deems appropriate, with any such bonus being payable at a time determined by the Compensation Committee. Qualification for any bonus will require that you are employed by the Company (and have not served notice of termination of your employment to the Company) at the discretion of the Compensation Committee.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly states that the employee 'will be eligible' for a bonus 'to a maximum value of 35% of your Earned Salary' if certain objectives are met. The modified text introduces uncertainty by stating 'may be eligible' and that 'specific details...will be determined annually by the Compensation Committee at its sole discretion.' This contradicts the original assurance of a defined bonus structure. The condition that the bonus is paid 'at a time determined by the Compensation Committee' also contradicts the original clause that the bonus would be payable in the first quarter of the following year. The added discretion about employment status also introduces uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text: 8.1 In addition to the usual public holidays you will be entitled to 25 working days paid holiday in each calendar year. The holiday will accrue on a pro rata basis throughout each calendar year.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.1 In addition to the usual public holidays you may be entitled to a certain number of working days paid holiday in each calendar year. The exact number of holiday days, and whether or not they will accrue on a pro rata basis, will be determined by the Company's policy in effect at the time, which may change from time to time.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause explicitly grants '25 working days paid holiday.' The modified clause introduces uncertainty by changing 'will be entitled to 25 working days' to 'may be entitled to a certain number,' making the holiday entitlement discretionary. The caveat that accrual and number of days 'will be determined by the Company's policy' creates a contradiction to the initial entitlement and injects uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text: 11.7 If your employment is terminated on account of your death or by the Company without Cause (being for any reason not covered by paragraph 11.3), or you terminate your employment for Good Reason (as provided in paragraph 11.4), in either case outside of the Change in Control Period, then the Company shall pay you the Accrued Benefits. In addition, subject to (i) your (or your authorised representative or estate signing, if the termination is due to your death) signing a settlement agreement and a separation agreement and release (together the "Settlement Agreements") in a form and manner satisfactory to the Company, which shall include, without limitation, a general release of claims against the Company and all related persons and entities, a reaffirmation of all of your continuing obligations to the Company, including those set forth in paragraphs 13 - 15, and (in the case of the separation agreement and release) and a seven (7) business day revocation period; and (ii) the separation agreement and release becoming irrevocable, all within 60 days after the Termination Date (or such shorter period as set forth in the Settlement Agreements), the Company shall: (A) pay you (or your authorised representative or estate if the termination is due to your death) an amount equal to nine (9) months of your salary as of the Termination Date (which payment shall not be reduced by either the value of any salary paid to you during your notice period or by any payment in lieu of notice made pursuant to paragraph 11.2); and (B) pay you (or your authorised representative or estate if the termination is due to your death) an amount equal to the cost to the Company of providing you with the contractual benefits under paragraph 5 for nine (9) months or, at the Company's option, continue to provide you with such benefits for nine (9) months.
perturbation.changed_text: 11.7 If your employment is terminated on account of your death or by the Company without Cause (being for any reason not covered by paragraph 11.3), or you terminate your employment for Good Reason (as provided in paragraph 11.4), in either case outside of the Change in Control Period, then the Company may pay you the Accrued Benefits. In addition, subject to (i) your (or your authorised representative or estate signing, if the termination is due to your death) signing a settlement agreement and a separation agreement and release (together the "Settlement Agreements") in a form and manner satisfactory to the Company, which shall include terms determined at the Company's sole discretion, a general release of claims against the Company and all related persons and entities, a reaffirmation of all of your continuing obligations to the Company, including those set forth in paragraphs 13 - 15, and (in the case of the separation agreement and release) and a revocation period to be determined by the Company; and (ii) the Settlement Agreements becoming irrevocable, within a timeframe determined by the company after the Termination Date, the Company may, at its sole discretion: (A) pay you (or your authorised representative or estate if the termination is due to your death) an amount up to nine (9) months of your salary as of the Termination Date (which payment may be reduced by either the value of any salary paid to you during your notice period or by any payment in lieu of notice made pursuant to paragraph 11.2); and (B) pay you (or your authorised representative or estate if the termination is due to your death) an amount up to the cost to the Company of providing you with the contractual benefits under paragraph 5 for up to nine (9) months or, at the Company's discretion, continue to provide you with such benefits, with duration to be determined by the company.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause mandates that 'the Company shall pay you the Accrued Benefits,' and the benefits are clearly defined. The modified clause shifts this to 'the Company may pay you the Accrued Benefits,' introducing uncertainty. Additionally, changing 'shall' to 'may' regarding severance benefits, as well as the addition of 'with duration to be determined by the company', introduces conflict. All terms are discretionary in the modified version.
